title: Israel-Hamas war: Killing of aid workers by Israeli strikes a 'grave mistake,' according to the army
summary: World Central Kitchen, the charity founded by celebrity chef José Andrés, said early Tuesday it was immediately pausing operations in the region, delivering a blow to the recently opened sea route for food aid.

title: Senegal's new president names opposition figurehead Sonko as PM, urges 'more solidarity' in Africa
summary: Bassirou Diomaye Faye, the country's youngest president was sworn in on Tuesday after sweeping to a first-round victory on a pledge of radical reform 10 days after he was released from prison.

title: Largest fresh egg producer in US found bird flu in chickens
summary: Mississippi-based Cal-Maine Foods, Inc. said in a statement that approximately 1.6 million laying hens and 337,000 pullets were destroyed after avian influenza was found at their Texas facility.

title: Why the UK's minimum wage is being called the 'most successful policy of a generation'
summary: The UK minimum wage, celebrating 25 years since it was first introduced in the country, has gradually risen with no negative impact on employment.

title: In Poland, widespread issuance of fake MBAs is making waves
summary: The Collegium Humanum University, with the backing of the populist majority in power until 2023, offered these valuable diplomas, obtained for a modest sum – and in less than a semester. They provided access to high positions in the country.

title: In China, the death of a 13-year-old rekindles the debate on the plight of migrant workers' children
summary: The murder of a teenager, reportedly at the hands of schoolmates, has sparked significant outrage in the country. Approximately 67 million children of migrant workers reside in rural areas, under the care of their grandparents.

title: Art Basel in Hong Kong opened its arms to 'New Gen' collectors
summary: Hong Kong's major international contemporary art fair, which closed on Saturday, returned to pre-pandemic figures. The market's resilience is attributed to new Asian collectors, who are often young, wealthy and enthusiastic.

title: French foreign minister focuses on cultural ties with China amid diplomatic divergences
summary: Stéphane Séjourné inaugurated an exhibition on Versailles and the Forbidden City in Beijing, but thorny issues such as the war in Ukraine and electric cars are complicating relations.

title: Tesla sales tumble nearly 9%, most in 4 years
summary: The auto company sales come against the backdrop of a slowing market for electric vehicles in the US. Its numbers also dragged down shares of its US EV competitors, with Rivian's stock dropping 5.2% and Lucid's falling 3.5%.

title: European elections: European socialists rally behind the notably discreet Nicolas Schmit
summary: The Luxembourgish Commissioner hopes that his group in the Strasbourg Parliament will slow its decline in the upcoming elections, scheduled to take place from June 6 to 9.

title: Palestinians relaunch bid to join the UN
summary: The Palestinians, who have had observer status at the world body since 2012, have lobbied for years to gain full membership, which would amount to recognition of Palestinian statehood.

title: Turkey: Tensions rise after ruling invalidating pro-Kurdish mayoral candidate victory
summary: During the nationwide municipal elections held on Sunday, March 31, Abdullah Zeydan from the Democratic Party (DEM) secured over 55 percent of the vote in Van, a city located on Lake Van approximately 80 kilometers (50 miles) from Turkey's eastern border with Iran.

title: Channel crossings are on the rise
summary: More than 4,600 migrants have reached the UK by small boats since the beginning of 2024. With the onset of spring, police are worried that crossings will intensify.

title: Maryse Condé, prolific Guadeloupean writer, dies aged 90
summary: The Caribbean 'giant of literature,' who examined the Black diaspora throughout her vast writing career, died at the age of 90 on Monday.

title: 12-year-old opens fire in Finnish school killing one child, injuring two others
summary: Police said that the attacker was in custody and 'all those involved in the shooting incident are minors.'

title: Disappearance of 2-year-old French boy still a mystery after nine months
summary: The discovery of bones belonging to Emile, missing since July 2023, may have put an end to months of questions regarding his fate but has not lifted the veil on the circumstances of his death.

title: 'A bell is the voice of God': The Paccard family's art of bell-making since 1796
summary: On the shores of Lake Annecy in eastern France, the Paccard family manufactures France's oldest bells, supplying churches all over the world.

title: Israeli troops leave Al-Shifa Hospital in ruins
summary: Gaza's largest hospital was ravaged by intense fighting between Palestinian militants and the IDF after the Israeli military's two-week raid.

title: Powerful earthquake triggers tsunami warnings in Philippines, Taiwan, Japan
summary: The Japan Meteorological Agency forecast a tsunami of up to 3 meters for the southern Japanese island group of Okinawa. A wave of 30 centimeters was detected on the coast of Yonaguni island about 15 minutes after the quake struck.

title: France's media landscape is at risk of a 'Hungarian-style' drift
summary: The decision by media outlets owned by billionaire Vincent Bolloré to favor far-right commentary over news coverage is reminiscent of Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban's strategy.

title: Peru: in Lima, the challenge of access to drinking water amidst climate change and urban growth
summary: One and a half million inhabitants of the country's capital don't have access to drinking water, as 'more intense, longer and more frequent' drought episodes point to a widespread water crisis.

title: 2021 Channel shipwreck: Has the French Navy interfered with the investigation?
summary: In November 2022, in the wake of a Le Monde investigation into the responsibility of the rescue services in the deaths of at least 27 people at sea in November 2021, the 'troubled' past of one rescue center operator was opportunely leaked to the press.
